content.raw:
Hi,

After a while, I was able to include the added-mass effect in [our simulation](https://github.com/rock-gazebo).
A trick was used to make Gazebo computing the desired acceleration by applying a compensated effort.
I found that this compensated effort needs to be proportional to the current effort applied in the vehicle (before physics update). Also, as Matrix6 is required, I used 4 Matrix3 to implement it. It would be nice to have Matrix6 in Ignition.

I think that using this method, and providing access to the forces to be manipulated before physics update, an underwater plugin can properly simulates the added mass effect.
This method also doesn't require a custom physics engine for the underwater environment.

Here is the [paper](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8232205/) with more details.

Any question or feedback is welcome.
